meico.app.gui

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.HBox
              • meico.app.gui.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    class Player
extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    The Player class provides the GUI for audio and Midi playback.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      • close

        public void close()
        This must be called on termination of the application in order to properly close the midi player. It helps keeping the constructor method less cluttered.

      • letTheSliderSlide

        private void letTheSliderSlide(long from,
                               meico.midi.MidiPlayer midiplayer)
        This makes the slider slide for as long as the player needs to reach the end of the music. So this is not really monitoring the player's playback position. But it is faked well enough.
        Parameters:
        from - start time in microseconds
        midiplayer -

      • letTheSliderSlide

        private void letTheSliderSlide(long from,
                               meico.audio.AudioPlayer audioplayer)
        This makes the slider slide for as long as the player needs to reach the end of the music. So this is not really monitoring the player's playback position. But it is faked well enough.
        Parameters:
        from - start time in microseconds
        audioplayer -
